snippet: One of the region’s most intractable conflicts may be nearing a close, thanks to the determination of the prime minister, yet ending violence will not end tension.
abstract: Memo from Diyarbakir; Turkish Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan has focused his attention on ending long and bloody conflict with Kurds; efforts, if successful, will bolster Turkey’s position as regional power, burnish Erdogan’s legacy as peacemaker and possibly propel him to presidency in 2014.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Diyarbakir, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: One of the region’s most intractable conflicts may be nearing a close, thanks to the determination of the prime minister, yet ending violence will not end tension.

headline.seo: Turkey Renews Focus on Peace With Kurds
headline.main: Turkey Renews Focus on Ending Its Long Conflict With Kurds
headline.print_headline: Turkey Renews Focus on Ending Its Long Conflict With Kurds
